name: Tabnine
tagline: Private, controllable AI coding platform (cloud, on‑prem, air‑gapped)
summary:
Tabnine is an AI coding platform focused on privacy, controllability, and enterprise deployment flexibility. In addition to SaaS, Tabnine supports private installations in a customer‑controlled VPC, fully on‑premises, and even completely air‑gapped environments with no external connectivity—targeting industries with strict security and compliance needs. The company positions “license‑safe” models and a Protected line trained on permissively licensed code. On the developer side, Tabnine provides inline completions, chat for code explanations and transformations, test generation, and repository‑aware context via an Enterprise Context Engine that integrates with code hosts and documentation.

Customer and partner write‑ups highlight productivity improvements and measurable ROI; examples include CI&T reporting 11% faster development and Google Cloud detailing how Tabnine uses its infrastructure to serve millions of developers. Documentation outlines deployment options and clarifies that free/pro users use the secure SaaS, while enterprise customers can choose private VPC, on‑prem, or air‑gapped. Tabnine’s blogs and guides discuss governance, privacy, and practical measurement frameworks (before/after comparisons, survey‑based attribution) for evaluating coding assistants at scale.

Tabnine is best for security‑sensitive organizations (finance, defense, public sector) that require on‑prem or air‑gapped options without sacrificing developer experience. Migration paths typically start with Free/Pro trials in SaaS, followed by Enterprise pilots and, if needed, private deployment with SSO and repository integrations.
pricing_notes: See pricing page for latest features and seat pricing.

cons: SaaS vs on‑prem feature parity can vary

migration_paths: Choose deployment: Secure SaaS, VPC, on‑prem, or fully air‑gapped (docs)
Enable SSO and connect repos; configure Context Engine
alternatives_notes: Compares with Copilot, Codeium/Windsurf, Cody, Amazon Q Developer

reviews.title: Air‑gapped deployments
reviews.author: Enterprise users (blogs)
reviews.body: Docs and blogs describe fully air‑gapped installs for the most sensitive environments.
